intro: Aporum humboldtense, commonly known as the Humboldt's aporum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
